alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 15 at 11:12AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A band of heavy snow will affect southern Washington and southeastern Hancock Counties... At 1111 AM EDT...An area of heavy snow was along a line extending from near Eastport to southwest of Bar Harbor...and moving west AT 15 MPH. At 11 AM, near zero visibility was reported in heavy snow near Cobscook Bay. Locations impacted include... Bar Harbor, Calais, Machias, Lubec, Eastport, Cherryfield, Deer Isle, Jonesport, Steuben, Stonington, Harrington, Perry, Pembroke, Princeton, Jonesboro, Columbia Falls, Cutler, Columbia, Meddybemps and Deblois. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Hancock and Princeton. State Highway 9 between Wesley and Calais. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington
